descr: "This resource identifies an instance or a type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device.  Medical devices include durable (reusable) medical equipment, implantable devices, as well as disposable equipment used for diagnostic, treatment, and research for healthcare and public health.  Non-medical devices may include items such as a machine, cellphone, computer, application, etc."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Device resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by manufacturers other organizations or owners."

fields.name: udi
fields.descr: "[Unique device identifier (UDI)](device.html#5.11.3.2.2) assigned to device label or package."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "Status of the Device availability."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Code or identifier to identify a kind of device."

fields.name: lotNumber
fields.descr: "Lot number assigned by the manufacturer."

fields.name: manufacturer
fields.descr: "A name of the manufacturer."

fields.name: manufactureDate
fields.descr: "The date and time when the device was manufactured."

fields.name: expirationDate
fields.descr: "The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable)."

fields.name: model
fields.descr: "The \"model\" is an identifier assigned by the manufacturer to identify the product by its type. This number is shared by the all devices sold as the same type."

fields.name: version
fields.descr: "The version of the device, if the device has multiple releases under the same model, or if the device is software or carries firmware."

fields.name: patient
fields.descr: "Patient information, If the device is affixed to a person."

fields.name: owner
fields.descr: "An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device."

fields.name: contact
fields.descr: "Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device."

fields.name: location
fields.descr: "The place where the device can be found."

fields.name: url
fields.descr: "A network address on which the device may be contacted directly."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element."

fields.name: safety
fields.descr: "Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device.  For example devices containing latex."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
